Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class TestCompareDump

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.TestCompareDump
public class TestCompareDump extends Object
Test class entirely dedicated to testing Phase.compare(Phase) and Phase.dump().

In each test a check for the presence of the phase's name is included, in addition to whatever the test is checking.

    characters()

    clouds()
    Comparing two cloud list will yield only the clouds that have been drained/filled.
    (package private) void
    currentPlayerNameChange()
    Comparing a phase with a current player and one without yields an attribute change and a name difference, if the same table is shared.
    (package private) void
    deepEquals()
    like equal(), however now the table has much more stuff in it, and it is not the same instance.
    (package private) void
    differentBoards()
    Comparing two phases that have a different board will yield the updated board
    (package private) void
    differentPlayerList()
    Comparing a phase with one that has a different player list will return a new player list and the boards of the extra players
    (package private) void
    differentProfessors()
    Comparing a phase that has different professors will yield a diff containing the different professor
    (package private) void
    dump()
    Checks that the diff returned from dump() contains at least one element for each of the possible keys.
    (package private) void
    emptySack()
    Comparing two phases, one with a non-empty sack and the other with an empty one yields a diff with one attribute containing a boolean.
    (package private) void
    equal()
    Compare against two equal phases yields an empty PhaseDiff
    (package private) void
    islandMerge()
    Comparing two phases, with different island lists will dump in the phase the full list structure and islands of the phase on the rhs.
    (package private) void
    motherNature()
    Comparing two phases, with mother nature in different positions, will yield one entity update with the different position
    (package private) void
    nullCheck()
    Null check
    (package private) void
    updateIslandNoMerge()
    Comparing two phases, both with the same list but different islands (with different number of students/towers/blocks) will yield only the changed

      Compare against two equal phases yields an empty PhaseDiff

    • deepEquals

      @Test void deepEquals()
      like equal(), however now the table has much more stuff in it, and it is not the same instance. It is more of a test of the various equals methods.

    • currentPlayerNameChange

      @Test void currentPlayerNameChange()
      Comparing a phase with a current player and one without yields an attribute change and a name difference, if the same table is shared.

    • differentPlayerList

      @Test void differentPlayerList()
      Comparing a phase with one that has a different player list will return a new player list and the boards of the extra players

    • differentProfessors

      @Test void differentProfessors()
      Comparing a phase that has different professors will yield a diff containing the different professor

    • differentBoards

      @Test void differentBoards()
      Comparing two phases that have a different board will yield the updated board

    • updateIslandNoMerge

      @Test void updateIslandNoMerge()
      Comparing two phases, both with the same list but different islands (with different number of students/towers/blocks) will yield only the changed

    • islandMerge

      @Test void islandMerge()
      Comparing two phases, with different island lists will dump in the phase the full list structure and islands of the phase on the rhs.

    • motherNature

      @Test void motherNature()
      Comparing two phases, with mother nature in different positions, will yield one entity update with the different position

    • characters

      @Test void characters() throws InvalidCharacterParameterException, InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      Comparing two phases, one before using a card and the other after using a card will yield: 1. the `usedCharacter` flag; 2. the character with its cost increased; 3. the board of the player with their coins scaled
      Throws:
      InvalidCharacterParameterException
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException

    • emptySack

      @Test void emptySack()
      Comparing two phases, one with a non-empty sack and the other with an empty one yields a diff with one attribute containing a boolean.

    • clouds

      @Test void clouds()
      Comparing two cloud list will yield only the clouds that have been drained/filled.

    • dump

      @Test void dump()
      Checks that the diff returned from dump() contains at least one element for each of the possible keys.
